meanings.sent1: She intercalates extra days into the calendar to make sure all events are accounted for.
meanings.sent2: The committee intercalates additional days into the schedule to accommodate more meetings.
meanings.sent3: The busy bee intercalates time for relaxation into her packed calendar.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled puzzle solver, he intercalates the missing days into the calendar effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The chef intercalates cooking classes into her weekly calendar to improve her skills.

meanings.definition: Insert (an extra month) in a calendar.
meanings.sent1: They intercalate an extra month into the lunar calendar to align it with the solar year.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, they intercalate a leap month to keep the lunar calendar accurate.
meanings.sent3: The magician intercalates an extra month into his calendar to have more time for practicing new tricks.
meanings.sent4: The artist intercalates an extra month into her calendar to complete her masterpiece on time.
meanings.sent5: The farmer intercalates an extra month for planting in his agricultural calendar to ensure a bountiful harvest.

meanings.definition: Insert (an extra day) in a calendar.
meanings.sent1: He intercalates an extra day into the calendar to account for the leap year.
meanings.sent2: The astronomer intercalates an extra day in February every four years to keep the calendar accurate.
meanings.sent3: The student intercalates an extra day into her calendar for a study marathon before the exam.
meanings.sent4: The coach intercalates an extra day into the training calendar for a special fitness challenge.
meanings.sent5: The teacher intercalates an extra day for a fun field trip in the school calendar to reward her students.

meanings.definition: Insert (an extra period of time) in a calendar.
meanings.sent1: They intercalate an extra period of time into the project schedule to ensure its completion.
meanings.sent2: The event planner intercalates an extra period of time for unexpected delays in the timeline.
meanings.sent3: The explorer intercalates an extra period of time for exploring new territories in his travel calendar.
meanings.sent4: The scientist intercalates an extra period of time for conducting thorough experiments in the research calendar.
meanings.sent5: The manager intercalates an extra period of time for team bonding activities in the work calendar to boost morale.
